alert.note: Alert for Berks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Pennsylvania...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in east central Pennsylvania...Berks, Lehigh, and Northampton. In southeast Pennsylvania...Montgomery. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 659 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in a short amount of time. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Allentown, Easton, Bethlehem, Pottstown, Emmaus, Northampton, Wilson, Hellertown, Nazareth, Birdsboro, Kutztown, and Slatington. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 37 and 75. Northeast Extension between mile markers 46 and 71. This includes the following DSS Events... Musikfest. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
